instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the battery’s power rail connects to the motherboard. .
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7152: What is R7152? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not powering from battery and not charging battery
threads.message:
Have a Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> here with battery charging and battery power issues. The battery will not charge and the computer will not run off battery. If loaded into the OS, it says "your battery needs to be replaced". I replaced the battery, now it just says no battery is installed (but it still gives the battery percentage at 52%!). I don't think it is the battery in this case. The charger shows green then orange.

<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL</SIGNAL> : Shows activity (also checked for connection to J6950, is fine)
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> : Shows activity (also checked for connection to J6950, is fine)
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> : Initially shows around 3V - 4V, but then drops to 0V after around 20 seconds
<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL>: 0.33V


Not sure what else to try. Other than the battery, when plugged into AC it works fine.

My only thought is with the <CHIP>U5000</CHIP> or <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, but visually - they seem fine.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not powering from battery and not charging battery
threads.message: Check / replace <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7152</RESISTOR>, r17150, <RESISTOR>R7115</RESISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>, also <CAPACITOR>C7116</CAPACITOR> for short. The simplest way is to replace charger chip and everything between <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and battery.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not powering from battery and not charging battery
threads.message:
Check / replace <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7152</RESISTOR>, r17150, <RESISTOR>R7115</RESISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>, also <CAPACITOR>C7116</CAPACITOR> for short. The simplest way is to replace charger chip and everything between [URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/isl6259ahrtz.html"]<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>[/URL] and battery. 

Ignore that please!

First question would be PPBUS voltage without battery connected. Second question would be to connect the old battery again and check what OSX says about the status/cycle count/etc.

My suspicion is you have 2 bad batteries. These machines need A1496 battery model!

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not powering from battery and not charging battery
threads.message: Certainly was the battery, had two duds! Thanks duke, and Inwerp wouldn't be too hasty with the hot air station! :D
